snippet: Health authorities said any risks of narcotics to newborns have been exaggerated, and if withdrawal symptoms do occur, they can be treated without any long-term effects.
abstract: Women's rights and medical groups are calling on Tennessee Gov BIll Haslam to veto legislation that will allow criminal assault charges to be filed against women who use illegal drugs during pregnancy; critics say measure will harm babies because pregnant women will be afraid to seek medical care.
lead_paragraph: Health authorities said any risks of narcotics to newborns have been exaggerated, and if withdrawal symptoms do occur, they can be treated without any long-term effects.

headline.main: Specialists Join Call for Veto of Drug Bill
headline.print_headline: Drug Bill Covering Pregnancy Gains Foes
